description:
# Worklog - Thiago Rodrigues

## Summary

| Field | Value |
| -- | -- |
| Period | Dec 16-17, 2025 |
| Slack | 350 events (183 my_work) |
| Drive | 39 events |
| Local | 20 events |
| Claude | 28 events |
| Linear | 0 events |
| **Total** | **437 events** |

## Objective

This worklog covers two days focused on WFS (Workforce Solutions) environment validation, the final All Pedals meeting of the year, team daily syncs with TSA members, and development of internal tooling for QuickBooks automation.

---

## WFS Mineral HR Integration Validation

Thiago conducted a thorough validation of the WFS integration with Mineral HR. He verified the complete access path in the GoQuick Alpha Retail environment, confirming that QuickBooks Online correctly connects to Mineral through the Payroll ‚Üí HR Advisor flow.

He documented the successful access verification and coordinated with Katherine to confirm the expected click path for sales reps to demonstrate WFS data flowing into Mineral. The validation confirmed Client Admin access with correct IDs.

Additionally, Thiago handled an environment issue escalation that originated from Intuit's engineering team, coordinating with Sam to ensure proper resolution tracking.

**Artifacts:**

* [Mineral-Client-Upgrade-FAQ.pdf](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1PNfecmh3vWY5Z8bYK3SWUUwybyzJJqRG/view?usp=drivesdk)
* [9 Payroll Employment Hero User Guide](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1jWMh6WwI_GJU3Z6CPIAXNspvfuoQmbiB/view?usp=drivesdk)

**Outcome:** WFS environment validated successfully. Access paths confirmed working. Environment issue documented and escalated appropriately.

---

## All Pedals Meeting - Year-End Presentation

Thiago coordinated the final All Pedals meeting of 2025, preparing customer implementation timeline slides and project status updates. He worked with the team to finalize the presentation content, including WFS and GEM project timelines.

He created the customer implementation timeline slides to show project status and launch dates, iterating on the format based on team feedback. He also coordinated with Alexandra regarding her presentation, which was deferred to January since this was the last All Pedals of the year.

**Artifacts:**

* [171225_All Pedals.pptx](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/11DgvMwk699bzgM4fh3KWy2bTXrIs4dmp/edit?usp=drivesdk)
* [Customer Implementation Timelines](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1GVpS1uUvvszCPte6AWxjFnte3jEF57aq/edit?usp=drivesdk)
* [06. All Pedals Folder](https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/132C9DoopEJQT2iEHw6Qk18m4p1yvLRll)
* [Customer Timeline CSV](https://drive.google.com/file/d/10bbLyZPT5m4ublvNFf1hvuTttlq033Rj/view?usp=drivesdk)

**Outcome:** All Pedals presentation completed and delivered. Alexandra's intro deferred to January kickoff.

---

## TSA Team Daily Syncs

Thiago conducted daily sync meetings with multiple TSA team members throughout these two days:

* **Diego Cavalli**: Discussed Intuit testing progress and project alignment
* **Gabrielle Cupello**: Reviewed Mailchimp slide updates and SOW status
* **Carlos G.**: Standard daily sync with recording
* **TSA Sync Escalation**: Team-wide escalation review meeting

He also facilitated discussions about TBX 3.0 documentation with team members, ensuring everyone understood the new company guidelines regarding meeting cadence and hierarchy usage.

**Artifacts:**

* [TSA Daily - Diego C. Notes](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-EecAmydIioU_F7ZSwGEtbyBBqgLEO9JO9woXC9cM_Y/edit?usp=drivesdk)
* [TSA Daily - Gabi C. Notes](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1iBlLn9-q0rDO3ac-Tpy5VJXjjoG57TdqXbRtrZeuZo0/edit?usp=drivesdk)
* [TSA Daily - Carlos G. Notes](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dVMagva9X141mglDa32pG-QiT6b_N-8mzifRM3DkAmE/edit?usp=drivesdk)
* [TSA Sync Escalation Notes](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MV3QoA3TxIUF3oV3xAlyqZWqjOsTScUvYOeKf2Wt_Ek/edit?usp=drivesdk)

**Outcome:** Team alignment maintained. Daily agendas refined and project priorities confirmed with all team members.

---

## Mailchimp SOW Coordination

Thiago coordinated with Gabrielle on the Mailchimp project SOW and presentation materials. He helped iterate on slide formats for the project status update and provided guidance on the timeline visualization approach.

The team discussed using a three-column layout instead of pipeline format for better clarity on project status and launch dates.

**Artifacts:**

* [External Mailchimp SOW](https://docs.google.com/document/d/16f2wAC3NoD1P8herOa6KSCUWUX9eas0aavRxLVQUzXQ/edit?usp=drivesdk)

**Outcome:** Mailchimp slide format finalized. SOW documentation under review by Gabi.

---

## QuickBooks Internal Tooling Development

Thiago worked on developing internal tooling for QuickBooks automation. He created an inventory tool using Claude Code to catalog existing automation components and documented the MCP QuickBooks spike findings.

He also compiled the TBX master knowledge bundle for team reference and tool standardization.

**Artifacts:**

* [Inventario_Ferramentas_Claude.xlsx](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1EP00z5fs6GG8E56TdQCeFSX-QjDqT37U/edit?usp=drivesdk)
* [MCP_QuickBooks_Spike.xlsx](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1AylW54C_xtlwGnvYWUJYquRcGQJTaj8O/edit?usp=drivesdk)
* [create_inventory.py](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1m4mTJGpnF2xh2HxFR02Jd99eo2f5zZnR/view?usp=drivesdk)
* [tbx_master_knowledge.md](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1b1_vxh4AnJ3matiWlj-aIcjlJlCV-v_C/view?usp=drivesdk)
* [tbx_master_bundle.zip](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1JhA1mUElv-x4C7mnbu0TCnZ2JT3Xa3dE/view?usp=drivesdk)

**Outcome:** Inventory tool created. MCP spike documented. Knowledge bundle compiled for team distribution.
